snippet: Because of an old law, the owners of many of New York’s highest-end apartments pay a far smaller percentage of the sales value than other condo and co-op owners do.
abstract: Elizabeth A Harris The Appraisal column notes, because of old state law mandating use of rental data, many luxury apartments in New York City have modest tax rates; cites apartments at 15 Central Park West that city valued at $322 per square foot, when $7,813 was average price per square foot for such apartments sold  over past 18 months.
lead_paragraph: Because of an old law, the owners of many of New York’s highest-end apartments pay a far smaller percentage of the sales value than other condo and co-op owners do.

headline.seo: Many High-End New York Apartments Have Modest Tax Rates
headline.main: As Prices Soar to Buy a Luxury Address, the Tax Bills Don’t
headline.print_headline: Luxe Homes With Low Tax Bills
